intro: Cassia guaranitica f. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf cassia, is a variant of the cassia genus native to South America. It is characterized by its large, broad, ovate leaves that are often glossy and dark green. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow, fragrant flowers that bloom in the spring. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and showy blooms. It is typically grown as a shade-tolerant shrub in gardens and landscapes.
